title.narrative: Hope for Eritrean Refugees in Ethiopia

description.narrative: The general target group for this response is Eritrean refugees in Hitsats, Shimelba, Addis Ababa and host communities in Shire including refugees planning for secondary movement. Within this group, the response has specific activities for youth, vulnerable individuals and children. Twenty-five percent of the beneficiaries will be targeted in the host community areas of Shire. The total number of people to be directly reached by this response is approximately 65,269 people: 48,952 refugees (6,409 in Shimbelba, 38,754 in Hitsats and 3,798 in Addis Ababa) and 16,317 host community members. The target group will be supported by activities in the following sectors: livelihoods, psycho-social support and energy for cooking at the household level.

The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the restoration of hope and reduction of dangerous secondary movement by improving the lives and livelihoods of Eritrean refugees and host communities in Ethiopia. This programme is implemented by Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus Development and Social Services Commission (EECMY-DASSC), Ethiopian Orthodox Church Development and Inter-Church Aid Commission (EOC-DICAC), ICCO and ZOA. Results published are on behalf of the whole consortium and not ZOA only.

This project will focus on the following objectives: Objective 1: To improve livelihoods of refugees and host communities through capacity building and strengthen market linkages. Objective 2: To improve the access of refugees and host communities to psycho-social care and safe recreation opportunities. Objective 3: To reduce pressure on the use of natural resources in and around the camps.

participating-org.narrative: Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus Development and Social Services Commission (EECMY-DASSC)
Ethiopian Orthodox Church Development and Inter-Church Aid Commission (EOC-DICAC)

location.ref: North-West Tigray Zone, Tigray National Regional State (Asgede Tsembela & Tahtai-Adyabo woredas)

name.narrative: North-West Tigray Zone, Tigray National Regional State (Asgede Tsembela & Tahtai-Adyabo woredas)

title.narrative: Output 1.3 Access to self employment / business facilitated
# of PoC provided with entrepreneurship / marketing and value chain training

comment.narrative: 40 beneficiaries withdrawn from VST, then missed the entrepreneurship / marketing and value chain training provided post VST.

comment.narrative: Interest of the beneficiaries to be organized into SHG

title.narrative: # of market linkages created

comment.narrative: Most of the IGG groups run business that do not require linkages and all most all businesses were established lately.

title.narrative: # of groups engaged in Income Generating Activities

comment.narrative: Running group based business in Addis Ababa for the refugee was very challenging as their settlement is very scattered.

title.narrative: # of women provided with seed money

comment.narrative: The plan was to provide seed money for 20 SHG which finally appeared to contain an average of 15 members.

title.narrative: # of individuals engaged in Income Generating Activities

comment.narrative: There was enough budget to add three additional target.

comment.narrative: Training was provided for SHG leaders so that they would cascade the training

comment.narrative: An integrated land-use plan was prepared through Consultancy (Aksum University) and delivered to Hitsats Tabya.

title.narrative: Output 3.2 Domestic fuel produced, provided and promoted (biomass briquettes)
# of households provided with energy saving equipments (stoves)

comment.narrative: 1,101 were provided with the stoves because Host community members are not provided and the total number of HH in Hitsats was estimated to be 1500…which actually is around 1, 101.

comment.narrative: 1,101 were provided with the stoves because Host community members are not provided and the total number of HH in Hitsats was estimated to be 1500…which actually is around 1, 101.

comment.narrative: As a result of the delay of the raw materials feasibility study, it was only possible collect 4,300 since the season for raw material collection has passed

comment.narrative: Host community members are not provided and the total number of HH in Hitsats was estimated to be 1500…which actually is around 1,101.
